Abrindo o file normalmente, não vemos nada. Abrindo com um Editor Hexadecimal, percebemos dois padrões:
Espaço = Hex 20
Ponto (.) = Hex 09

Em informática só temos 0 e 1. Substituindo os Espaços (Hex 20) por 0 (Hex 30) e os Pontos (Hex 09) por 1 (Hex 31), temos uma sequência binária:

0100111100100000011000110110000101110010011011100110100101110110011011110111001001100101001000001100001110101001001000000110110101110101011010010
1110100011011110010000001101100011010010110110101101001011101000110000101100100011011110010110000100000011100000111001001100101011000110110100101
1100110110000101101101011011110111001100100000011011010110111101101110011010010111010001101111011100100110000101110010000010100110111011000011101
0001101101111001000000110000101110000011001010110111001100001011100110010000001100001011100110010000001100011011011110110110101110101011011100110
1001011000110110000111000011101001111100001110110101011001010111001100100000011001000110010100100000011001000110000101100100011011110111001100101
1000010000001101101011000010111001100100000011000010111001100001010011101000110010101101100011001010110011011000011101101000110111001101001011000
1101100001011100110010000001110100011000010110110101100010110000111010100101101101001011100000101000001010

Convertendo pra ASCII, temos a flag:

O carnivore é muito limitado, precisamos monitorar
não apenas as comunicações de dados, mas as
telefônicas também.
